Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Class JSONDeserializer

java.lang.Object
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONDeserializer
public final class JSONDeserializer extends Object
This class is used to deserialize JSON into Java objects. It uses annotations and reflection to instantiate objects and populate them with the appropriate data. The main static methods each take a JSON and a Java type, which are then used to deserialize the JSON data to the appropriate Java object. The Java type must point to a Java type that this system is compatible with. This includes most Java Collections and all primatives and wrapper classes. You can create your own compatible objects by annotating a class with the DeserializedJSON annotation family (see JSONDeserializable).
See Also:
JSONSerializer

  • Method Details

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(JSON json, TypeMarker<T> typeMarker) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Deserializes a JSON to a Java type specified by a given TypeMarker. Returns an object of the same type as the TypeMarker.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the TypeMarker
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON data to convert to a Java object
      typeMarker - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type <T>
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the JSON or type marker is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the TypeMarker is not fully resolved (if it contains type variables)
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(JSON json, Class<T> typeClass) throws NullPointerException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Deserializes a JSON to a Java type specified by a given Class. Returns an object of the same type as the Class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the Class
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON data to convert to a Java object
      typeClass - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type <T>
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the JSON or type class is null
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

      public static <T> T deserialize​(JSONEntry jsonEntry, Class<T> typeClass) throws NullPointerException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Deserializes a JSONEntry to a Java type specified by a given Class. Returns an object of the same type as the Class.

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(String jsonString, TypeMarker<T> typeMarker) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException, JSONParserException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Parses a string using JSONParser, then deserializes the JSON to an object of the type specified in the TypeMarker.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the TypeMarker
      Parameters:
      jsonString - the string to parse and deserialize
      typeMarker - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type T
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the string or type marker is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the type marker contains an unresolved type variable
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the JSON in the string
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(String jsonString, Class<T> typeClass) throws NullPointerException, JSONParserException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Parses a string using JSONParser, then deserializes the JSON to an object of the type specified in the Class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the TypeMarker
      Parameters:
      jsonString - the string to parse and deserialize
      typeClass - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type T
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the string or type marker is null
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the JSON in the string
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(File jsonFile, TypeMarker<T> typeMarker) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException, IOException, JSONParserException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Parses the contents of the file as a string using JSONParser, then deserializes the JSON to an object of the type specified in the TypeMarker.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the TypeMarker
      Parameters:
      jsonFile - the file to parse and deserialize
      typeMarker - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type T
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the file or type marker is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the type marker contains an unresolved type variable
      IOException - if there is an error when reading the file
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the JSON in the file
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

    • deserialize

      public static <T> T deserialize​(File jsonFile, Class<T> typeClass) throws NullPointerException, IOException, JSONParserException, InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration, JSONDeserializerException
      Parses the contents of the file as a string using JSONParser, then deserializes the JSON to an object of the type specified in the Class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the Java type that the JSON is being deserialized to; it must agree with the TypeMarker
      Parameters:
      jsonFile - the file to parse and deserialize
      typeClass - the type of Java object to create
      Returns:
      the newly created and populated Java object of type T
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the file or type marker is null
      IOException - if there is an error when reading the file
      JSONParserException - if there is a syntax error in the JSON in the file
      InvalidJSONTranslationConfiguration - if the deserializable type has an invalid annotation configuration
      JSONDeserializerException - if there is an error while deserializing

    • unescapeString

      public static String unescapeString​(String escapedString) throws NullPointerException, JSONDeserializerException
      This method removes the escape sequences from JSON strings and returns strings that contain the actual characters. This can be used both internally in deserialization and publicly by users.
      Parameters:
      escapedString - the escaped string to be unescaped
      Returns:
      the unescaped string
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the escaped string is null
      JSONDeserializerException - if the string contains an invalid escape character
